quotes.quote: The truest state of humanity is that you're living for other people.
The truest interpretations are those with the best justification.
The truest poetry is the most feigning.
Being kind without expectation is the truest kind of kindness.
The truest writers are those who see language not as a linguistic process but as a living element.
Virtue is the truest nobility.
The truest smiles are those which spread across our faces when no one's watching us.
The truest tales require time and familiarity to become what they are.
In the truest sense, freedom cannot be bestowed; it must be achieved.
The truest help we can render an afflicted man is not to take his burden from him, but to call out his best energy, that he may be able to bear the burden.
The truest comparison we can make of love is to liken it to a fever; we have no more power over the one than the other, either as to its violence or duration.
One of the truest things to commit to is your own nature.
The truest friends are usually the ones telling you what you don't want to hear.
The truest test of independent judgment is being able to dislike someone who admires us, and to admire someone who dislikes us.
The truest expression of a people is in its dances and its music. Bodies never lie.
The most heartbreaking things are the ones that are sometimes the truest.
The truest indication of gratitude is to return what you are grateful for.
The sure mark of one born with noble qualities is being born without envy.
Time is the truest form of wealth. And the beauty is, we are all born equally rich in time.
The truest success is but the development of self.
One of the truest tests of integrity is its blunt refusal to be compromised.
The truest drive comes from doing what you love.
The truest self-respect is not to think of self.
The truest end of life is to know that life never ends.
A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
The joy of creating is the truest joy.
The simplest things are often the truest.
The truest mark of your success in life will be the quality of your marriage.
In the truest sense, Christian pilgrims have the best of both worlds. We have joy whenever this world reminds us of the next, and we take solace whenever it does not.
The truest experience of life is when we dream awake.
